page.description: One or more Button objects may appear inside the Format section of a UI_DLG_BOX() function.
page.syntax: < [ %Directives% ][ * ][ Width ][, Height ]. Label [ & ] Label [ = Variable ][ ! Event ][ ? Enabled ] >

argument.name: %Directives%
argument.description: Refer to Xdialog Language Directives and Operators.
Character. The leading < and trailing > characters are required.
Character. Optional. Indicates that this is the default button on the Xdialog.

argument.name: Width
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. The width of the control.

argument.name: Height
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. The height of the button in units (specified by the {UNITS} command).
Character. Optional. Precedes the letter that is the hotkey for the button.

argument.name: Label
argument.description: Character. The label of the button. The optional "= Variable " syntax allows you to use the contents of a variable as the button label.

argument.name: Event
argument.description: Character. The name of the event generated by the button.

section.title: Example
section.example: format = <<%dlg% Hello World <*Click Here> %dlg% ui_dlg_box("Simple Xdialog", format)
